intro: Hesperalcea malachroides, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its tall, sturdy stems and large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant is adapted to arid environments, with a deep root system that allows it to survive in drought conditions. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in a waxy cuticle to reduce water loss. Hesperalcea malachroides is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in full sun.
